name: PATCH Request
descriptionHtml:
The HTTP `PATCH` method is used to update resources on a server. The exact
use of `PATCH` requests depends on the server in question. There are a number
of server implementations which handle `PATCH` differently. Technically,
`PATCH` supports both Query String parameters and a Request Body.

This endpoint accepts an HTTP `PATCH` request and provides debug information
such as the HTTP headers, Query String arguments, and the Request Body.

Request:

PATCH - https://postman-echo.com/patch

raw 
  Curabitur auctor, elit nec pulvinar porttitor, ex augue condimentum enim, eget suscipit urna felis quis neque.
Suspendisse sit amet luctus massa, nec venenatis mi. Suspendisse tincidunt massa at nibh efficitur fringilla. Nam quis congue mi. Etiam volutpat.

Response:

200 - OK 

  {
  "args": {},
  "data": "Curabitur auctor, elit nec pulvinar porttitor, ex augue condimentum enim, eget suscipit urna felis quis neque.\nSuspendisse sit amet luctus massa, nec venenatis mi. Suspendisse tincidunt massa at nibh efficitur fringilla. Nam quis congue mi. Etiam volutpat.",
  "files": {},
  "form": {},
  "headers": {
    "x-forwarded-proto": "https",
    "x-forwarded-port": "443",
    "host": "postman-echo.com",
    "x-amzn-trace-id": "Root=1-65c52e8f-2b54069a43d6eb440e4785bd",
    "content-length": "256",
    "content-type": "text/plain",
    "user-agent": "PostmanRuntime/7.36.1",
    "accept": "*/*",
    "cache-control": "no-cache",
    "postman-token": "421ce13b-86fe-45ae-8cf7-fa6b3ffbee31",
    "accept-encoding": "gzip, deflate, br",
    "cookie": "sails.sid=s%3AEaRD7KtfTIzcT524gJS7rvYYGOhAZuBX.mDIhRjSqtTBTCeNKGwagl5XwFyK%2BpgWORJjzSQhs0ZI"
  },
  "json": null,
  "url": "https://postman-echo.com/patch"
}
